tool.name: RUSLE

param.name: Output_folder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder name where output from this tool should be stored.

param.name: Preprocess_folder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder where the output from the Preprocess data tool is stored.

param.name: Rainfall_erosivity
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the rainfall erosivity raster.

param.name: LS_option
param.expression: Calculate based on slope and length only | Include upslope contributing area
param.dialogReference:
This tool has two options to estimate the effect of slope length and steepness:

  • Calculate based on slope and length only: This method only accounts for slope length and steepness as specified by Morgan [2].

  • Include upslope contributing area: This method includes slope length, steepness, and upslope contributing area as specified by Moore and Burch [3]. This method may require more processing time if the study area is large or the DEM is high-resolution.

Default is Calculate based on slope and length only.

[2] Morgan, R. P. C. (2005) Soil Erosion and Conservation. National Soil Resources Institute, Cranfield University.

[3] Moore, I. D., & Burch, G. J. (1986). Physical Basis of the Length-slope Factor in the Universal Soil Loss Equation. Soil Science Society of America Journal, 50(5), 1294–1298.

param.name: Kfactor_option
param.expression: Use preprocessed soil data | Use local K-factor dataset
param.dialogReference:
This tool has two options for determining K-factor depending on the dataset that will be entered in the parameter K-factor: Soils or erodibility datasetbelow:

  • Use preprocessed soil data: Choose this option if the input soil dataset is from the Harmonized World Soils Database and has been preprocessed in the Preprocess data tool.

  • Use local K-factor dataset: Choose this option if using a pre-existing K-factor dataset for this study area.

param.name: Soils
param.dialogReference:
This input depends on the K-factor option outlined above.

If Use preprocessed soil data was selected, this input can be left blank. The soil dataset will be pulled from the preprocess data folder.

If Use local K-factor dataset was selected, specify the path and filename to the raster, shapefile, or feature class that contains the K-factor dataset and values.

param.name: Soil_linking_code
param.dialogReference: Specify the field that contains the unique identifier for the input K-factor dataset. For rasters, this field is typically VALUE. For feature classes/shapefiles, this field is dependent on the creation of the dataset.

param.name: Cfactor_option
param.expression: Use preprocessed land cover data | Use local C-factor dataset
param.dialogReference:
This tool has two options for determining C-factor depending on the dataset that will be entered in the parameter C-factor: Land cover or cover factor dataset below:

  • Use preprocessed land cover data: Choose this option if the input soil dataset is from the ESA CCI global dataset and has been preprocessed in the Preprocess data tool.

  • Use local C-factor dataset: Choose this option if using a pre-existing C-factor dataset for this study area.

param.name: Land_cover
param.dialogReference:
This input depends on the C-factor option outlined above.

If Use preprocessed land cover data was selected, this input can be left blank. The land cover dataset will be pulled from the preprocess data folder.

If Use local C-factor dataset was selected, specify the path and filename to the raster, shapefile, or feature class that contains the C-factor dataset and values.

param.name: Land_cover_linking_code
param.dialogReference: Specify the field that contains the unique identifier for the input C-factor dataset. For rasters, this field is typically VALUE. For feature classes/shapefiles, this field is dependent on the creation of the dataset.

param.name: Pfactor_dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the support practice (P-factor) raster.

param.name: Save_factor_layers
param.dialogReference: Tick this box to save the RUSLE layers to the output folder.

param.name: Rerun_tool
param.displayname: Rerun tool (will continue previous run from the point where any errors occurred)
param.dialogReference: Check to rerun the tool if it fails prior to completion. The rerun will start again from the point of failure rather than starting the tool from the beginning.

tool.summary:
This tool estimates the annual soil loss (tonnes/ha/yr) using the Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation (RUSLE) [1] approach.Before running this tool, run the Preprocess data tool to run consistency checks and recondition the digital elevation model if required. This tool requires the following datasets:

  • Digital Elevation Model: from the Preprocess data tool, this DEM can either be the raw input DEM or the reconditioned DEM

  • Soil

  • Land Cover

  • Rainfall erosivity

Instructions for which datasets to download and how to acquire some globally-accessible land cover, soil, and rainfall erosivity datasets can be found here.

This tool also allows the user to input their own datasets for soil erodibility (K-factor) and cover (C-factor) if available or they have made their own parameterisation with their soil or land cover data.If the user has made a P-factor dataset for their study area, it can be input in the optional parameter P-factor: support practice dataset.

[1] Renard, K., Foster, G., Weesies, G., McCool, D., & Yoder, D. (1997). Predicting soil erosion by water: a guide to conservation planning with the Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation (RUSLE). In Agricultural Handbook No. 703. https://doi.org/DC0-16-048938-5 65–100.
